headline: Ingersoll Rand (IR) Valuation Check After Rotation Into Defensive Industrial Stocks
summary: Ingersoll Rand (IR) moved higher as part of a broader shift into defensive industrial stocks after President Trump proposed a major defense budget increase that could lift sector wide demand. See our latest analysis for Ingersoll Rand. That rotation into defensive industrials has come on top of a steady backdrop, with a 90 day share price return of 10.71% and a 3 year total shareholder return of 49.10%, suggesting momentum has been building even as the latest move is tied to policy...

headline: 3 Reasons to Avoid IR and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Ingersoll Rand has been treading water for the past six months, recording a small loss of 2.4% while holding steady at $85.51. The stock also fell short of the S&P 500’s 10.4% gain during that period.
